intro: Chaetanthera stuebelii, commonly known as the Stuebel's chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers and has a distinctive, aromatic scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
